paper_abstract: The aim of this paper is to propose a framework for modeling semantic interactions in large multiagent communities. By semantic interaction we understand the act of modifying the internal knowledge representation (in the form of semantic network or ontology) as a result of communication between agents. The proposed framework takes into account the latest results investigating structure of large semantic networks and communication patters in diverse multiagent environments.
paper_title: Towards a computational framework for modeling semantic interactions in large multiagent communities
